newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary's MVM signs agreement with France's EGT.
newsitem.headline: Hungary's MVM signs agreement with France's EGT.

text.p: French energy group European Gas Turbine, subsidiary of GEC Alsthom, signed a $60 million agreement with Hungarian electricity supply company MVM Rt to deliver two gas turbine reserve power plants.

"This reserve capacity will be installed in record time, will significantly increase the safety of the Hungarian system, and via this the safety of consumers," said Antal Tombor, MVM's Managing Director, told the signing ceremony.
The deal also includes maintenance work for the turbines for 10 years.
European Gas Turbine will deliver two gas turbines, each with 125 megawatts and manufactured by GEC Alsthom in France, to be installed in 14 months.

The World Bank extended MVM a $60 million loan for 15 years with a five-year grace period earlier this month to build the two gas turbines, one in Sajoszoged, north-east Hungary, and Liter, central Hungary.
By this investment Hungary will fulfill its obligation taken when it joined the west European electricity network (UCPTE) in 1995.
